title: Reading Comprehension: From Theory to Practice
abstractText:
There is a significant body of research concerning how children learn to decode text and how best to foster childrenâ€™s decoding skills. However, less is known about the process of reading comprehension in children. One consequence of this is that the evidence-base available to inform the teaching of reading comprehension is limited. This series of seminars aims to bring together researchers and professionals from the field of reading and language to consider how research on the development of reading comprehension might inform educational practice. The series will be multi-disciplinary and embrace a variety of different methodologies with presentations from international experts as well as early career researchers. 

The programme of seminars focuses on:

  • Theoretical, empirical and educational perspectives on reading comprehension
  • Language foundations of reading comprehension
  • Working memory and text comprehension
  • Interventions to promote reading comprehension.
impactText: Two of the organisers were invited to join a government working party to consider the inclusion of comprehension-related activities in the Foundation Years curriculum. Education Societal
